Package com.sanderjurgens.metroplanner.gui

Class VisLine

java.lang.Object
com.sanderjurgens.metroplanner.gui.VisLine
public class VisLine extends Object
Visual representation of one complete metro line. Note that this class is not a (Vis)Component, instead it is explicitly drawn onto the MapPanel.
Author:
sanderjurgens

  • Constructor Details

    • VisLine

      public VisLine(Line line, Color color)
      Constructs a new metro line.
      Parameters:
      line - the line that this visual object represents
      color - the color of this line on the map

  • Method Details

    • getLine

      public Line getLine()
      Return the visual representation of a line corresponding to a line.
      Returns:
      the line that this visual object represents

    • addStation

      public void addStation(VisStation station)
      Append a station visualization to this line visualization.
      Parameters:
      station - a visual represents of a given station

    • addBetweenStations

      public void addBetweenStations(VisStation from, VisStation to, List<VisStation> betweenStations)
      Add a list of stations between two existing adjacent stations. This is handy for adding in the bends (i.e. dummy stations).
      Parameters:
      from - the first station of the segment
      to - the last station of the segment
      betweenStations - the stations to add between from and to

    • showNone

      public void showNone()
      Don't show any part of this line.

    • showSegment

      public void showSegment(RouteSegment segment)
      Show some part of the line (on top of what was already visible). Note that this function assumes the given segment does not overlap an already visible part of the line.
      Parameters:
      segment - the segment to be shown in the visualization

    • showAll

      public void showAll()
      Show every part of the line.

    • draw

      protected void draw(Graphics graphics)
      Draws all visible parts of the line onto a Graphics object.
      Parameters:
      graphics - the Graphics context in which to draw
